newsitem.title: FRANCE: French island of Corsica shaken by fresh bombings.
newsitem.headline: French island of Corsica shaken by fresh bombings.

text.p: Two bombs exploded overnight on the French Mediterranean island of Corsica, damaging a driving school and a bank but causing no casualties, police said on Sunday.
No one immediately claimed responsibity for the blasts but Corsican separatist guerrillas seeking greater autonomy from mainland France stage regular bombing attacks on the island.
The blast in front of the driving school in the southern Corsican town of Porto-Vecchio smashed the school's windows and damaged internal walls.
Another branch of the school owned by Corsican businessman Christian Pujula was bombed two weeks ago.
The bank bombing blew out the windows at a branch of the Banque Populaire Provencale et Corse in Bastia, northern Corsica, police said.
